content.description: Starting on the lowest, and furthest right crack then opening with a powerful move up, all the while having no feet, makes this short boulder exceptionally challenging. from there follow the line up and to the left around the arret to top out. An ulternate version of this bolder starts above the crack, traverses around the arret and becomes a V1-2.
content.location: Walk down towards the lake and stream, about 50 ft off the trail.

content.description: Start as low as you can get your hands on the big pizza slice shaped slab's right arret. move up from there to top out on the left. Great introduction to the kind of edge heavy slab bouldering you'll find in the area. Watch out as the down climb is a bit sketchy on either side - mat placement can be tricky in this area so exercise caution.
content.protection: a bit sketchy in this area for mat placement, 3 or more a recommendation to cover the rocks at the base
content.location: About 100 feet further down hill from Sôskadabi Traverse. Follow the stream down toward the lake, vere off to the left as soon as you see some boulders/ledge. Unmistakable pizza/wedge shaped granite rock.

content.description: Buried in a mature hardwood forest this very old granite quarry has a number of natural and man-made boulders all following a small seasonal stream towards the lake front.
